sections.heading: Welcome
sections.content: Welcome to Google Merchant Center Documentation. This comprehensive guide will help you understand all requirements and processes needed to get your store approved on Google Merchant Center.

sections.heading: Purpose of This Documentation
sections.content: This documentation provides a complete guide to getting your store approved on Google Merchant Center. It covers all requirements, processes, and best practices.

sections.heading: Introduction to Google Merchant Center
sections.content: Google Merchant Center is a platform that allows you to upload your store and product data to Google, making it available to potential customers through Google Shopping and other Google services.
sections.imageAlt: Google Merchant Center Next - Overview page showing account setup
sections.imageCaption: Google Merchant Center Next interface - Overview page with account setup prompt

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: Getting your Google Merchant Center account approved is a critical milestone before you can showcase your products on Google Shopping. Understanding the approval process helps you avoid common pitfalls and ensures a smoother path to launching your campaigns.

sections.heading: What Google Reviews
sections.content: When you submit your Merchant Center account for approval, Google conducts a comprehensive evaluation of both your website and product data. This review process typically occurs automatically after you complete the initial setup steps, though manual reviews may be triggered in certain cases.

sections.heading: Website Compliance
sections.content: Website compliance is the first layer of review. Google's automated systems crawl your website to verify that it meets technical requirements like HTTPS security, mobile responsiveness, and functional navigation. They also check that all mandatory legal pages are present and easily accessible from your website footer.

sections.heading: Product Data Accuracy
sections.content: Product data accuracy is scrutinized to ensure the information in your feed matches what's displayed on your website. Google compares product titles, descriptions, prices, availability, and images between your feed and landing pages. Any discrepancies can trigger disapprovals.

sections.heading: Policy Adherence
sections.content: Policy adherence is evaluated across all aspects of your business. Google verifies that you're not selling prohibited or restricted products, that your checkout process is transparent, and that customers can complete purchases without unnecessary barriers.

sections.heading: Timeline and Expectations
sections.content: The initial account review typically takes between 3 to 7 business days after submission, though some accounts are approved within 24 hours. During this period, Google may request additional verification documents or clarifications about your business.

sections.heading: Review Notifications
sections.content: You'll receive notifications through your Merchant Center dashboard and email regarding your approval status. If issues are detected, Google provides specific reasons for disapproval in the Diagnostics section of your account.

sections.heading: Common Approval Requirements
sections.content: Non-negotiable requirements that must be met include:
list: HTTPS security on your entire website
Clear data and privacy protection policy
Compliance with Google's prohibited content policies

sections.heading: Business Legitimacy Verification
sections.content: Business legitimacy verification includes confirming your business name, physical or legal address, and contact information. You may be asked to provide a phone number for verification purposes.

sections.heading: Website and Feed Alignment
sections.content: Website and feed alignment requires that your Merchant Center account uses the same domain as your website URL. Product landing pages must link directly to the correct product without redirects.

sections.heading: The Review Process Steps
sections.content: Follow these steps to complete the approval process:

sections.heading: Step 1: Complete Account Setup
sections.content: Complete all required account setup fields including business information, shipping settings, and tax configuration.

sections.heading: Step 2: Verify Your Website
sections.content: Verify and claim your website URL using one of four methods: HTML tag, HTML file upload, Google Analytics, or your e-commerce platform integration.

sections.heading: Step 3: Upload Product Feed
sections.content: Upload your product feed with all required attributes properly formatted according to Google's product data specification.

sections.heading: Step 4: Review Policies
sections.content: Review and acknowledge Google's shopping policies, including guidelines on prohibited products, data quality, and customer experience.

sections.heading: Step 5: Submit for Review
sections.content: Submit your account for review when prompted in your Merchant Center dashboard.

sections.heading: What Happens After Approval
sections.content: Once approved, your products become eligible to appear in Google Shopping results. However, approval is not permanent—Google continuously monitors accounts for policy compliance.

sections.heading: Maintaining Your Account
sections.content: You must sign in to your Merchant Center account at least once every 14 months to keep it active. Regular monitoring of your product status is essential, as individual products can be disapproved even after initial account approval.

sections.heading: Handling Disapprovals
sections.content: If your account or products are disapproved, Google provides detailed explanations in your Diagnostics Hub. Common disapproval reasons include:
list: Price mismatches between feed and website
Broken links or incomplete product descriptions

sections.heading: Resolving Disapprovals
sections.content: Most disapprovals can be resolved by making the necessary corrections and resubmitting your account or products for review. Price mismatch errors often auto-resolve within 24 hours after Google recrawls your website.

sections.heading: Pre-Submission Checklist
sections.content: Before submitting for review, verify that:
list: All required policies are in place and easily accessible
Your website is secure with HTTPS and fully functional across devices
Product details and pricing match exactly between your feed and website
The checkout process works smoothly without forced registrations
You comply with all Google Shopping Ads Policies

sections.heading: Final Notes
sections.content: Following these guidelines significantly improves your approval chances, though Google's final decision remains at their discretion based on their policies and automated review systems.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: Google Merchant Center requires specific technical and quality standards for business logos that appear in your Shopping ads. Understanding these requirements ensures your logo gets approved quickly and represents your brand effectively across all Google Shopping surfaces.

sections.heading: Logo Format Requirements
sections.content: Your logo must meet specific format requirements to be approved by Google Merchant Center.

sections.heading: Square Logos
sections.content: Square logos must use a 1:1 aspect ratio with dimensions between 500×500 and 2000×2000 pixels. This format is ideal for mobile displays and compact ad placements where space is limited.
sections.imageAlt: Example of square logo format (1:1 aspect ratio)
sections.imageCaption: Example: Square logo format (1:1 aspect ratio) - 500×500 to 2000×2000 pixels

sections.heading: Rectangular Logos
sections.content: Rectangular logos require a 2:1 aspect ratio with dimensions between 1000×500 and 2000×1000 pixels. The minimum height is 128 pixels, and the width cannot exceed 2000 pixels.
sections.imageAlt: Example of rectangular logo format (2:1 aspect ratio)
sections.imageCaption: Example: Rectangular logo format (2:1 aspect ratio) - 1000×500 to 2000×1000 pixels

sections.heading: File Format
sections.content: File format must be either JPG or PNG. Google recommends uploading both square and rectangular versions to ensure optimal display across all ad formats and placements.

sections.heading: Logo Requirements Summary
sections.content: Quick reference for logo requirements:
list: Square logos: 1:1 aspect ratio, 500×500 to 2000×2000 pixels
Rectangular logos: 2:1 aspect ratio, 1000×500 to 2000×1000 pixels
File formats: JPG or PNG only
Recommended: Upload both square and rectangular versions

sections.heading: XML Feed Example
sections.content: Here's a complete example of a product feed in XML format.

sections.heading: Sample XML Feed
sections.content: Example product feed structure:
sections.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rss version="2.0" xmlns:g="http://base.google.com/ns/1.0">
  <channel>
    <title>My Store Products</title>
    <link>https://mystore.com</link>
    <description>Product feed for My Store</description>
    <item>
      <g:id>SKU123</g:id>
      <g:title>Premium Wireless Headphones</g:title>
      <g:description>High-quality wireless headphones with noise cancellation</g:description>
      <g:link>https://mystore.com/products/headphones</g:link>
      <g:image_link>https://mystore.com/images/headphones.jpg</g:image_link>
      <g:availability>in stock</g:availability>
      <g:price>299.00 USD</g:price>
      <g:condition>new</g:condition>
      <g:brand>Sony</g:brand>
      <g:gtin>1234567890123</g:gtin>
      <g:product_type>Electronics > Audio > Headphones</g:product_type>
    </item>
  </channel>
</rss>
